transparency_law: Oregon Public Records Law - ORS Chapter 192

agencies.name: Office of the Governor

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Office of the Governor, 900 Court Street, Suite 254, Salem, OR 97301

agencies.notes: Handles gubernatorial records, executive orders, appointments, and official correspondence

agencies.name: Oregon Health Authority (OHA)
agencies.description: State's primary health services and programs agency

public_records_contact.office: OHA External Relations Division Public Records
public_records_contact.mailing_address: Oregon Health Authority, 800 NE Oregon St, Portland, OR 97232

agencies.notes: Handles health records, vital records, public health data, and health facility information

agencies.name: Oregon Department of Transportation (ODOT)
agencies.description: Manages state transportation infrastructure and services

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Oregon Department of Transportation, 355 Capitol St. NE, MS 11, Salem, OR 97301-3871

agencies.notes: Handles transportation records, highway projects, traffic data, and infrastructure planning documents. Staff available Monday-Friday 8:00am-5:00pm

agencies.name: Oregon Department of Education (ODE)
agencies.description: Oversees K-12 public education and higher education coordination

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Oregon Department of Education, 255 Capitol St NE, Salem, OR 97310

agencies.notes: Handles education records, curriculum documents, and school district information (student records protected). Written requests required.

agencies.name: Oregon Secretary of State
agencies.description: Administers elections and maintains official state records

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Oregon Secretary of State, 136 State Capitol, Salem, OR 97310

agencies.notes: Handles election records, corporate filings, notary records, and official state documents

agencies.name: Oregon State Treasurer
agencies.description: Manages state investments and financial operations

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Oregon State Treasurer, 350 Winter St NE, Salem, OR 97301

agencies.notes: Handles investment records, bond information, and state financial management documents

agencies.name: Oregon Attorney General
agencies.description: State's chief legal officer and law enforcement coordination

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Oregon Department of Justice, 1162 Court Street NE, Salem, OR 97301

agencies.notes: Handles legal opinions, consumer protection records, criminal investigation oversight, and public records guidance

agencies.name: Oregon Department of Human Services (ODHS)
agencies.description: Provides social services and benefits programs

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Oregon Department of Human Services, 500 Summer St NE, Salem, OR 97301

agencies.notes: Handles social services records, benefit program information, and child welfare data (personal info protected)

agencies.name: Oregon Department of Revenue
agencies.description: Administers state tax laws and collects revenues

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Oregon Department of Revenue, 955 Center St NE, Salem, OR 97301

agencies.notes: Handles non-confidential tax records and revenue administration documents (confidential tax info protected)

agencies.name: Oregon State Police

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Oregon State Police, 400 Public Service Building, Salem, OR 97310

agencies.notes: Handles law enforcement records, incident reports, and public safety information (ongoing investigations protected)

agencies.name: Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife (ODFW)
agencies.description: Manages wildlife resources and outdoor recreation

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife, 4034 Fairview Industrial Drive SE, Salem, OR 97302

agencies.notes: Handles wildlife management records, hunting/fishing licenses, and conservation program documents

agencies.name: Oregon Department of Environmental Quality (DEQ)

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Oregon Department of Environmental Quality, 700 NE Multnomah St, Portland, OR 97232

agencies.notes: Handles environmental monitoring data, permit information, and compliance records

agencies.name: Oregon Employment Department
agencies.description: Provides unemployment benefits and workforce services

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Oregon Employment Department, 875 Union St NE, Salem, OR 97311

agencies.notes: Handles employment statistics, workforce development records, and unemployment insurance data

agencies.name: Oregon Department of Agriculture
agencies.description: Regulates agriculture and promotes agricultural development

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Oregon Department of Agriculture, 635 Capitol St NE, Salem, OR 97301

agencies.notes: Handles agricultural regulation records, inspection reports, and farming industry documentation

agencies.name: Oregon Department of Administrative Services (DAS)
agencies.description: Provides administrative services to state government

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Oregon Department of Administrative Services, 155 Cottage St NE, Salem, OR 97301

agencies.notes: Handles procurement records, state property documents, and administrative services information

agencies.name: Oregon Emergency Management
agencies.description: Coordinates emergency preparedness and disaster response

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Oregon Emergency Management, 3225 State St, Salem, OR 97301

agencies.notes: Handles emergency planning records, disaster response documents, and preparedness information

request_process.how_to_request: Written request required with name, address, and description of records
required_information: Mailing address or electronic mail address

agency_response_time.response: Within 15 business days unless written justification provided for longer period

fees.copying: Reasonably calculated to reimburse actual costs
fees.advance_notice: Written estimate required if fees will exceed $25
fees.waiver: May be waived if disclosure primarily benefits general public

request_process.appeals_process: May petition District Attorney or Attorney General for review; court review available with attorney fees for prevailing party

key_exemptions: Personal information that would constitute unreasonable invasion of privacy
Information submitted in confidence and not required by law
Trade secrets with independent economic value
Records specifically exempt by court order
Records prohibited from disclosure by Oregon law
notable_features: Strong policy of public access - 'every person has a right to inspect any public record'
Conditional exemptions require public interest balancing test
Required written acknowledgment within 5 business days
15-business-day response deadline with justification required for extensions
Fees may be waived if primarily benefits public interest
District Attorney or Attorney General review process available
Attorney fees available for prevailing parties in court challenges
